pages.text: Yunnanoascus is a genus of enigmatic animal known from the early Cambrian Maotianshan Shales, China. This around 2 cm tall animal was first described in 2007, and it was originally described as a member of ctenophore. However, a study done in 2016 considered that it was actually a crown-group medusozoan, which makes it the earliest definitive jellyfish ever known. When interpreted as a jellyfish, it was considered to have sensory structures called rhopalia.
In 2023 however, its affinity as crown-group medusozoan was questioned, and a ctenophore affinity is once again suggested.
